review_body: This unit is very close to Waikiki beach and they cut our parking to $20 per night. These were the main positives of the resort. Otherwise, the unit is very small and not comfortable. We would not stay here again. Very pricey for all that we got. We were told there was laundry, but when we went to use it, it was down. Then they said they had been trying to get the maintenance to fix it, but because it was the holidays, they would not come out... So it must have been broken for several weeks....

We havve been to waikiki 4 other times and have never had such bad experiences. First off I booked the wrong place and right away called to ask for a refund. withen 20 minutes. That was not an option with this place, although every other place in this area offers cancelation options. Got here and the place had no blankets or pillows. Then there was roaches. At night there was a loud explosion right outsidee our room with cops and ambulances for hours. My husband walked to the store last night and almost got mugged. Really shaddy area. not good for families at all. We are talking with management to see if we can move from here or resolve some issues. I will post again with an update. this is our first night here, of a 12 day stay.

Very disappointed in the condos. Did not look anything like the photos. Dirty and water leaking from the AC units. The bathroom looked old and dirty with paint peeling. We didn’t even stay our first night there, switched hotels to avoid staying there.

This may be the worst hotel in Waikiki. The door had been kicked in recently as the lock and bolt plate was hanging by a screw. Loud window AC barely worked, hot as hell in the room. We were afraid to leave anything in the room as it is clearly robbed regularly and they don't even fix the broken lock. Do not stay here...just pay $20 more and stay someplace better. Also...they must use a fisheye lens to make the room look bigger, they are tiny.

We stayef there for 10 days. The location is marvellous, you cannot miss any action at and around. Wiki ki. Accomodation was dated. but very convenient over all. Rent car is next door. , beach and. al most. all Wikiki attractions are on walking distance and of. course. Hawaii is the place of preference for the. family. Look forward to take my. newly born to Hawaii. in. 2020.

We booked here knowing we were using the room for sleeping, showering and cooking only. We wanted a kitchen to save on the expenses of eating out all the time, and didn't want a 5 star luxury as we wanted more money to spend on activities. The people at the front desk were very helpful and kind and made a taxi reservation for us for the next day. When we decided to drive instead, they very cheerfully cancelled for us. Would definitely stay again.

The condominiums are a perfect place for the price! Full kitchen with big balcony's beds are comfortable. The staff is always friendly. Michelle is always nice and accommodating both times I was there. I will always come here if available when visiting.

You have to go to a different hotel to check in. We had to carry our heavy suitcases up a tiny staircase. The sleeper couch was so uncomfortable. Poor area without much to do, see or eat. We landed up shortening our stay to just one night.

We wanted a room with a kitchen, and not too expensive, l think it was overpriced for what we got, but the beds were comfy and the linen fresh and the shower was great. So close to everything probably reflects the price. The rooms are serviced each day. There was a coffee machine but no coffee pot to go with it, no plug for the kitchen sink, and the phone didn’t work, so that shows the rooms aren’t cared for very well.

Stay Condominiums charges an extra $50/day for parking at the condo. Having a car is absolutely necessary if you plan on leaving waikiki to venture out to tue north shore. The walk to the beach is very short from the condo.

when we arrived the staff wa very accommodating. We knew we were staying in a lower priced condo. afterall,we are there to sleep shower and explore.The kitchen were equiped with the amount of utensils to cook eggs and bacon for breakfast and a couple of dinners. Saving money is key in hawaii.They could add a draw curtain between the main bedroom and the foldout couch living room to add some privacy.also could add a round plastic table and 2 more chairs to the patio to accomodate 4 people.We had an excellent stay. Yes it can get loud at night. No it is not high end on the beach. BUT for a cheaper way to go only 2 blocks from the beach it was perfect.

This place is not a true condo. It is more like a dorm room and the size of a dorm room. White brick walls all around, windows you cant see out of, no chairs, no tables, no rugs. There is no place to sit and eat so you must sit on your bed and eat your food. Every morning at 6:30 we heard the trash trucks right outside our window. There is also a car rental place right next store so there is a lot of noise and action going on very early. This place also charges $45 dollars a day for parking so be aware. The "dorm room" is very old and needs updating and some color. It is a perfect place to stay in if you are between the ages of 18-28 and you just flat out dont care about any type of amenities or luxuries and you just need to a place to lay your head down somewhere and take a shower. The great thing about this place is that the front desk clerks were very friendly and helpful when we never had the right amount of towels in our room to shower with and it is only two blocks from the beach and close to downtown.

For the price and location it was very good. Wouldn’t pay more for it in the future though. Fresh sheets on our bed had some holes and stains already so we had to remake our whole beds. Liked the private patio so no one could knock on our door, felt safe with all the locks. Called when we forgot the gate code and the desk gave it to us without asking our name or room though.

Good location but lots of little extra fee's that start to rack up very quickly. My initial room had no working AC, TV, microwave...etc. They moved me to a second floor hotel room that was right above a karaoke bar, which was extremely loud all night. I was moved back to the condominium the following day with working electrical items but the room itself was pretty low quality, felt very dirty, and I was extremely glad to finally check out.Spend a bit more and get a quality room elsewhere.

Excellent prime location, a minute walk from Waikiki beach. The condo looks to be old, but inside its good. And the customer service is very helpful. We want kitchen as we cook few items for kids and surprisingly the cleaning staff washed the dishes as well.

Overall our stay at the hotel was decent; the room was clean, the customer service was excellent, and the promixity to the beach was amazing. The sole issue we found was the nightly noise level, we stayed on the 3rd floor and we could hear constant commotion and loud noises until the early morning hours. If sleep isn’t an need, then highly recommend this hotel. We raised the nightly noise level to the hotel and they attempted to move us to another room-but another room wasn’t available. We visited the karaoke bar downstairs and it was quite fun! The flaw of the hotel was made up in other areas. B- overall.

Be aware on checking you will be hit with the $15 a night amenities fee. That means Wi-Fi is not free. You check in at the hotel across the street. Are they touring the hotel my girlfriend and I were shocked. It is not as advertised. The floor is so dirty that my Japanese girlfriend did not want to take your shoes off in the condominium. All the cabinets were old and dirty. Some of the Cabinets and Doors have been eaten Away by termites at the base. This is not the clean bright rooms they advertise. About three or four inches away from the wall all the way around the condo the floor is never been cleaned disgusting dirt everywhere. And cockroaches everywhere everywhere cockroaches. Cockroaches on your food plates cockroaches in your luggage cockroaches waving to you while you're eating your breakfast. It's good we did not spend much time in the condo. Because my girlfriend's been most of her time screaming and tried to shoot the Cockroaches out the broken sliding glass door. The screen door for the sliding glass door was just laying there against the wall. I guess no one goes out there to check anything. The location of this place is ideal. That's why we chose it. I parked in the parking structure near the condo and paid for 5 days with the parking. They towed my car anyway and charge me almost $300 to get it back. I used to live in Hawaii. And I used to go to Waikiki a lot before I move there. It was never like this. My advice used to stay away from Waikiki all together. It has changed into a tourist trap of epic proportion. I came here to visit my friends who all live on different parts of Oahu. They all said he's really changed in the last few years. Oh and did I mention the homeless people everywhere. All over Waikiki Beach. Homeless people drunk people everywhere. People screaming and fighting all night when you're trying to sleep. This is a disgusting hellhole and should be avoided at all costs

NOT A CONDOThis is a NOT the 3-star condo nor a 1 bedroom unit as advertised. This is a single room that has a king bed, a futon/couch, and a small kitchen. There is NO OTHER FURNITURE. No table, no chairs, no desk, nothing! There is no divider between the bed and the rest of the unit.The location is 2 blocks from the beach, but the rest of the location is terrible. There is an Alamo rental car right next door, so all the units hear the cars starting, stopping, radios blaring, horns honking, and alarms going on. Across the street is the back side of the King’s Village shopping center (which will be closing at the end of January 2019 and replaced by a new hotel). So at 4 am, yes, 4 in the morning, garbage trucks are on the narrow street revving engines, backing up with their beepers, lifting dumpsters, and making a lot of noise. At least units 1, 4, and 8 are impacted by this, but probably more. There are 3 parking space for 11 units and they are $45 per night. When you check in, they will recommend 3 other locations that are $30/night.This was supposed to be a 1 bedroom condo for 4 people. It is a single room as said earlier. For four people, it had 3 sets of towels, 3 forks, 7 spoons, and 11 knives. It did have 4 dinner plates and salad plates and 4 coffee cups, but only 2 tall glasses and 2 both of which were cracked in multiple places.It had a single cup coffee maker, but they ran out of regular coffee one day and only had decaf. It takes special packets (not k-cups) so you can’t really even buy coffee. It has a single window air conditioner which struggles to keep the place at 72 degrees even when it is only 74 at night out side, but you can’t open the door to the balcony at night because it is too loud. All the windows are louvered windows, but most don’t stay open either and if you are in a front unit will just let in even more noise than they already do. The food AC unit had to run so hard and so loud all the time, it never stopped. At least a ceiling fan would help.Pain is peeling every where and the paint job is sloppy, runs and drips. The floors were so dirty that upon arrival and walking across the room once, our feet were black. We used one of the 5 bath mats to mop and sweep the floor when we arrived. The TV is mounted on a corner wall, so you bump into it when trying to walk between the the bed and the wall. It has a small “shelf” above it that is just 2 brackets that cost $2 at Home Depot and a 12 inch by 9 inch piece of peg board not even painted and NOT screwed down. We nocked it down once accidentally and it scared the crap out of us.The stove top in our unit was bent like someone stood on it to get to the shelves above. One of the burners (electric) was broken. They have one power strip in the kitchen with the microwave, coffee maker, phone, and cable decoder all plugged into it. The same duplex outlet in the wall that had the power strip also had the air conditioner plugged in. Expedia advertises this at a 3-Star for typically $250 per night and we got it for half price on a Black Friday 2018 sale. This is not a 3-Star unit. The person who took the pictures that are on line should get an award for how good they made this sparse studio apartment look.

My note to the GM of the property...1) roach traps all over the room2) broken cabinet doors that won’t close properly3) generally dirty, including filthy floors, shower, drawers and cabinets 4) misleading pictures online5) no seating outside of a futon which is being used as a bed. There was nowhere to eat in the room. Note, your website showed bar seating. Vanessa offered to bring barstools to the room but it’s absurd that a patron should even have to complain about this.6) broken tv (We were told the tv had been broken for some time and you were waiting for a part from your corporate office somewhere in the Midwest, all of which is absurd.)7) no blankets on the bed or in the room upon arrival. It took 2.5 hours and a trip to the front desk to get them.8) nasty shower curtain that only covers about half of the shower and resulted in a soaked floor with every shower9) amenities charge for next to nothing in exchange. I’ve never stayed at a hotel that charges for coffee and tea in the lobby or towels. 10) outrageous parking cost, higher than almost anything nearby, and even higher than many high-end hotels in San Francisco. Additionally, there weren’t spots available adjacent to the apartment on one of the nights even though we had paid for it. 11) Requested one hour later check out at noon was met with resistance. I was told I could only make the request the day of. This is ridiculous given you don’t allow your guests to check in until 4 pm. This isn’t a condo. It is a cinderblock, studio dump. It’s very clear your owners don’t care about this property and have done little to maintain it with any integrity or quality. The best thing this place has going for it is Amy who worked the front desk the first couple of days we were here. She was apologetic and kind enough to address some of our concerns by comping the amenities fee and also one night of parking. --

Beat Expectations. Was worried due to many negative reviews but this place was quiet and the room was clean. I would stay here again and was a value for the money.No bedspread but had clean sheets and many pillows.

The bed was most uncomfortable as the 2 mattresses to make it "king size" were not level which resulted in a "hump" down the middle. There was no toaster (for bagels) and no kettle for boiling water for tea (we used a saucepan). The TV only had 1 channel working for our entire 5 day stay. On the plus side the condo was clean and the WIFI worked well.It should be rated no more than a 2 Star (it is rated 3) and we would not stay here again.

I booked because I wanted a kitchen to prepare my meals. All four burners and ovendidn't work, refrigerator was broken spoiling purchased food, request for hotplate was refused, the provided teflon pans were horribly scratched, no cutting board or can opener. Faucet dripped and shutoff under sink had to be used, tv didn't work. No chair or even a small table to eat or work. No screen on sliding door and no towel bars. Most of the A.C.'s dripped on sidewalks and levels below. Poor maintenancerestocking or inspection of units. Front desk refused to document non functioning of kitchen as requested by my credit card company. $15.70 amenities fee includeswifi in lobby, coin washer, ice machine, cable tv, and beach floats.

Although we only stayed for the one night we were very happy with our stay. Extremely clean, was very impressed. Unit had all we needed, would most definitely stay here again. We also overlooked Alamo car rentals, enjoyed watching people choose and pick up their cars in the morning. Thank you Stay Condos u helped make our holiday enjoyable...Mahalo

Great location, and the kitchen was really helpful. Wish there was a pool and elevators, though. Our room overlooked the Alamo car rental lot, and was often noisy. The main office is across the street in another building, which was confusing, too. The staff in that building was very accommodating, though. We would go back.

Staff was very nice and willing to answer any questions you may have, parking is very hard to come by around the area, but you shouldn't really need a rental unless you have to go back and forth to JBPHH like I did, very close room to the beach and walking distance of the rest of Waikiki.

Was just here for one night but it was a nice, quiet, cool space to spend the night. Had a full kitchen setup but I didn't have time to use any of it. Parking in this area is kind of a big pain, but the front desk staff are knowledgeable and helpful in directing you to options.

Our arrival at Stay Condominiums Waikiki was a rough one. We were treated badly by the front desk agent during check-in The frustrating part was there was no reason for treating us badly. We were willing to comply with all the hotel policies. At one point the front desk agent just started ignoring us and wouldn't respond to our questions. We also witnessed her treating other guests badly too. It seemed like she was having a rough day, and was taking out her frustrations on the guest. It really dampened how excited we were to be in Hawaii. On the bright side, outside of this one employee, we didn't have any problems. The rest of the staff we encountered were friendly and professional.Although the condo was a bit worn, my room was clean and housekeeping appear to do a good job. The highlight of staying here is the great location. It's such a short walk to the beach. Very convenient.If you are looking for a luxury, this isn't the place for you. It's for budget travelers. For more luxurious accommodation, be prepared to pay more, or you need to find accommodation further from the beach.

If you have stayed in Waikiki you know how pricey even the budget places are. By the way, if you're going to be in Honolulu, Waikiki should be your only option and the closer to the beach the better. The Stay Hotel and Condominiums is a mere 2 minute walk to Duke Kahanamoku's statue. I chose the condo which cost a little less but had a huge amount of room an a full kitchen with balcony. As well, I had all the facilities the Stay Hotel had across the street. The staff was super considerate and very kind and helpful. Even the missing tv remote did not spoil my stay.Just around the corner the area is a wee bit iffy, but I felt quite safe there.

I won't use Priceline again thanks to this place. This is not a 3-star location as advertised, its a poorly-maintained motel with an odd kitchen. If you read the responses from the GM it shows a clear pattern of attempting to apologize and deflect without ever fixing material defects. As Danny M said on 8/22/2016 the photos are glossed up: I see that the GM - so happy to respond - still hasn't updated them to be more accurate.  The property has a kitchen but no dining table, bar stools or basically any place to eat. We took a cookie sheet and placed it on the luggage rack. But that's OK it allowed us to look at the severely scratched cafeteria flooring from my public-school childhood. This (the lack of tables) was mentioned in prior reviews too on 3/9/2016, 1/10/2017, 2/03/17. The first time the GM talked about pending upgrades, I note now they are quiet on that.But at least it's a place to sleep, wait no it isn't because the louvered windows (some cracked) block no noise and the neighboring car rental company has alarms going off at 3 AM - and, the less said about the apartments next door who power sawed, hammered and yelled until 9PM each night the better. Best you can hope to do is drowned it out with the overly loud, broken and moldy A/C unit. But hey for us it was in the kitchen (so it cooled almost only that) and not over our bed like in some photos (which is just horrible). The bathroom is equally horrible with a pocket door and a hook-and-eye closure, two mismatched shower handles, only one place to hang a towel and a broken toilet.  I feel like I could have had a better stay in the roach motel in under the sink. Look, if you’re a college student who doesn't much care about quality: this may be for you, but if your a business traveler, family or someone who wants a modicum of comfort/safety/peace: look elsewhere. After my dissatisfaction I realized Priceline did me no favors, I could have gotten a real hotel for not much more. Also, just be advised the hotel charges $45 for first-come-first-serve parking, a car as mentioned in prior reviews may be a hindrance... but, if you need transport, the public lot in the neighboring hotel only charges $30. The hotel is the Aqua Pacific Monarch and the entrance to the lot is on Kuhio Ave before Uluniu Ave. I only mention this because the desk agent was unable or unwilling to provide the location on check-in, rather I was told there are a "few" public lots around, The walk is worth the savings in my opinion. Please, read ALL the reviews of this place before booking and decide for yourself.

The receptionist gave us the wrong info about our room and we keep get back to her to reconfirm the location as our room are located another buidling like 3 storey condo instead of hotel as we thought. The room is ok just the receptionist are so unprofessional giving us wrong direction and did not apologize but insist that she is right. The building was in white colour but she told us its pink then the room was ground floor but she told us level 2 and the worst is no lift but only staircase ! Lucky i did not carry all the luggage so i run up to check is the room at level 2 as she mentioned ! Finally the room info was wrong also and the room just located ground floor.,.,.,

We stayed at Stay Condo for 24days & was very pleased, clean condo/friendly staff. Convenient location to everything. The only negative is the noise, will carry earplugs next time. Looking forward to our next trip. Thanks Stay Condo for a wonderful stay.

I’ve stayed here now twice, & love it! The only bummer is early early morning bus & truck traffic, but it is a tourist area, so I think you can expect that... Carolyn, Richard, Luzie,Lynn, & Evelina were all so helpful with anything I needed! The little kitchen was great to be able to make quick snacks & only 2 blocks from the beach! It’s the BEST! Thank you guys!

Staff are friendly. Very close to the beach and attractive shops and places to eat. It was perfect if the room were a bit newer and cleaner. You need to check in and out at the Stay Hotel near this place, which might be a bit inconvenient, and we need to be familiar with the location because those two places are not really on the same street.

The great thing about this hotel is how conveniently is located to nearby shops and rental places. You need an early breakfast? There's breakfast places just within a block. Need a quick stock of supplies before heading out to North Shore? Just down by the corner is an ABC store. If you're going to Chief's Luau by thr Sea Life Park, the shuttle (rsvp and payment needed) is across the street picking up mostly Hyatt-Regency guests. The wifi is actually not that bad, but I suggest you download a VPN app for your devices for added online security. There's personal computers down by the lobby, but use only for search, I suggest do not use it to log on to any of your accounts. There's also a karaoke bar down at the lobby. I never got to go but it seems a nice place to chill for a bit. If you need beach mats, body boards and towels, just ask at the front lobby. One thing I like was the free use of laundry. It just means I can pack less clothes and just wash and reuse what I bought.Now, the downsides when my friend and I went to stay at this hotel. Just like some guests had mentioned, the garbage truck pickups is really loud in the morning. It's not that big of a deal to me as I'm usually an early riser but my friend was not so much of a fan. We also had a toilet that makes this very high pitched sound after each flush. I had to open up the toilet back cover, isolate the issue, and found that air is coming out from the fill valve not closing completely. A simple flick up to close it well is all it takes. Minor but very annoying issue when you had to take a minor wee in the middle of the night, flush it, go back to bed. Only to get up again 2 minutes to fix the high pitch sound.

My family and I stayed over for the weekend and I must say it was the most peaceful experience we've ever had in Waikiki. We're used to staying in crowded hotels, but I'm so happy we chose to stay here. Granted it's located in a side street where it looks a little scary to walk down at night, but it's located where it's close to the beach and there's so much choices to pick from to eat or just walk around and browse. The building is gated so I felt secure at night. The room is very simple, with all the necessities you need. The full kitchen was a lifesaver with the good sized refrigerator. The room was clean, and overall, it was worth what we paid for. We didn't need fancy, just somewhere to lay our heads down. We definitely don't mind staying here again. Every year my daughter has a surf contest at waikiki beach, only minutes away from the condo, and this is the perfect starvation for us! Thank you Stay Waikiki!

Wow, the greatest customer service I have ever experienced. Mike specifically went above and beyond for us IMHO - he even remembered my name throughout the entire stay. The rooms may look a little dodgy from the outside, but the inside has most everything you would need - especially if you are looking to spend your $$$ on activities and experiencing the island and not so much on accommodations. Kitchen with amenities for cheaper meals, and everything was clean.The city was doing some sewer work on the second day of our stay, and we had an issue with our plumbing as a result. Mike straightened out the street work quickly, moved us to a different room immediately, and even helped us move all of our stuff to the new room himself. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful, and even the laundry facilities were great. Loaner items for the beach were a plus. The location was great - very close to the beach and all of the shopping (open air market, food, etc.)If I could make any recommendations, I would suggest that the slate windows be updated to something a little more soundproof. The NBA Finals were going on, but we didn't need to watch it - we could hear the play-by-play from the neighbors. Also, I had to do some work on my laptop and I didn't have a table/desk in my room to use.Overall a wonderful experience, and I would recommend this to hotel to anyone, but especially first time visitors on a budget. Thanks again Mike!

Straight up, go in knowing what you are paying for. I have provided photos to help demonstrate this. The accommodation is literally two streets back from the beach (refer nice view photo!). But, as the other photos show, it's a little rough, which for the price should be expected as you are literally right next to an amazing beach paying bargain basement prices for the area. You can't have it both ways, and for us, we were happy to save the money to spend on activities.The units are loud. The air con is also loud and positioned above a bed. The hotel is next door to a car rental. This was actually a great help as we decided on the spur of the moment to rent a mustang for an unforgettable drive around the island. We would have unlikely done this if we weren't over looking all the cars.The staff were really kind and accommodating. We had the units attended to every day of our stay and they had everything we needed to enjoy our holiday in Waikiki. Would I stay here again - with the partner, no; with my mates though, probably! If you were able to, I would give them a 3.5 rating.

Our whole family of 5 went to Honolulu on a budget. We stayed at this condo, and it was worth it. Very close to Waikiki beach (5 min walk, a couple of blocks away). Very basic but clean rooms. You get free beach towels, and free rental of beach balls, float, mats, etc (you get these from the lobby of the HOTEL, which is a stone's throw away from the CONDO).

The condo is basic cinder block and plywood construction.THE GOOD: Price, location, courteous staff, provide necessities for cooking (plates, silverware, pots, pans, pot holders, etc.) and beach needs (towels along with chairs, umbrellas, etc. on a 1st come basis).The BAD: Needs a thorough cleaning (edges and corners dirty), the louvered windows provide no sound insulation from street noise, and early (5-7am) garbage truck servicing and car rental operation next door, difficult to keep all the light out of the rooms due to security and street lights, water pressure issues in kitchen and bathroom sinks, water pressure in shower good despite only 70% flow from defective diverter valve, it took 6 days to get a working TV satellite box but mgt. was considerate enough to refund facility fees. Primary recommendation, windows should be replaced to reduce noise.

This property was so bad that I had to walk out and book another hotel. They claim that they are a 3-star property, it should not qualify for 1 star. The fact is its location is amazing and you will be tempted to book it if you check its picture and its map. They have a decent concierge located on another street, but their service is horrible. The property is unhygienic, iron bed frames just horrible.

Even though it was under $100 per night:Just like recent reviewers, garbage trucks start at 5-6:00 am, every morning. They go get huge metal dumpsters and bring them to the condo location for 3 or 4 hours. A pickup brings the dumpster, drops it onto street, garbage truck picks it up, dumps garbage in back then bang,bang, bangs metal on metal to make sure it's empty, then lowers it & drops it on street for pick up to carry away. Then they return and repeat this all morning! Bang, crash, whirring of hydraulics, air-brakes screeching. Sounds like they're in the room! To make matters worse, Alamo Rentals is next door. Every morning from about 7: am til 10: am they honk honk leaving to move the cars out, and even worse…carry around a huge key-chain that accidentally sets of the car alarms, and use the car alarm on purpose to find the car. No patio furniture and only furniture indoors is bed and a couch. Bathroom pocket-door wouldn't shut completely, toilet seat broke in half-what?! No electrical outlet in bathroom, have to dry hair at the couch, no mirror! The office, coffee, etc is across and down the street. ON the plus side; they have floaties, goggles, snorkel and beach towels to borrow. AND its a quick 1 block walk to Waikiki beach. I wouldn't stay there again if it were free.

If anyone thinks about staying at Stay Condominiums, Waikiki perhaps you should think again. Garbage trucks start clearing the street at 5am and Alamo rentals start moving their cars out from around the same time and into the nextdoor block in the evening. Among the many annoying aspects of the noisy apartments is the sound of screeching metal, loud airbrakes, engines starting, horns blaring all starting 5am. The contents of the room are minimum there was no table to eat from or chairs, there was no balcony furniture and the room seemed older than Hawaii itself. The best thing was the location and possibly the bed but desperation finally leads to collapse. Good luck if you stay at Stay.

Just a lil 5 day vacation to Waikiki, We get up early on Jan 26 at 3 am drive for almost two hours to get to LAX by 7, We get there by 6:45, awesome. Flight leaves at 8;30, but nooooo they had to change an engine (we found out later) so to make a long story short we were supposed to arrive by noon to 1 pm instead we leave 12 hours late and get in at 12:30 in the morning the next day. So what if we lose a whole day of vacation ( that's how delta made up feel) any way the condos are down and across the street from the stay Hotel. So we call and a nice lady comes and gets my wife while I watch our bags and G-ma. The rooms are very so so. Not enough outlets, no chairs to sit on or even a table on the deck??? I was told they removed them for the new furniture coming in. Who removes furniture before the new stuff arrives??? Oh and the garbage trucks come early in the morning and it sounds like they are in the room with you!!! We were in room E8 third floor, No elevator either. But the location is very good and close to everything you want.

Rooms don't have proper windows, thus you definitely need ear-plugs to be able to sleep. AC is noisy as well. There was well equipped kitchen but no kitchen table in the room, nor on the balcony, so breakfast at bed was the only option. TV had 2 channels. Wifi was good. Cleaning happened only once during our 5 day stay. Location is super. Close to beach, super market, nice restaurants, laundry and Alamo-car rental.

Good spot in waikiki very central to to everything. Only problem is the street was real loud most mornings with garbage trucks etc and the room didnt block out much of that noise. Other then that a nice sized room and close to beach shopping etc

There wasn't much to recommend this place..... our family of six needed to rent two apartments, which turned out to be just as well....The first apartment toilet was found to be blocked the first time it was flushed. Used toilet contents welled up and over the top on to the floor. The management were advised immediately and assured us that a plumber would fix it promptly. A cleaner came over and mopped the floor but no repairman showed up and it was still like that when we checked out the following day. They offered us a $10 discount. In the other apartment the bathroom sliding door was broken and needed to be lifted and jiggled along to open and close it. Mostly we had to leave it ajar as it was too hard to close properly. The rooms were dark. The sheets on my son's bed were dirty (footprints and grease stains) when we arrived and needed replacing. The most basic requirements for a motel room are a clean, comfortable bed and toilet/bathroom facilities. The Stay Condominium left us down in both respects.

Room was simple, but it was clean. When you're on vacation you don't spend too much time in your room anyways so who cares if it was plain and who cares if the bathroom was small. It was big enough to fit comfortably. Yes it does get loud but it is technically the city part and those are the noises you hear in the city. Maid service came everyday and even did the dishes. Their was tv and free wifi for the nights you just wanted to come and relax. I would come back!

I HATE hotels, so I wanted a place close to the main beach in Waikiki, close to a supermarket and close to the main transport lines. Stay Condos are perfect for this. The condo was just like the pictures, of course not as glossy (whoever thinks anything is real life is as glossy as the internet pictures needs to get real). I filled my full sized fridge with groceries (from Food Pantry close by) and was able to cook with the good pans and utensils. The bed is comfortable and the whole place was clean. The only thing I wasn't terribly happy with was the very noisy air conditioner. I would stay here again in a heartbeat, it felt like my (basic) home away from home. The staff ae vey welcoming, friendly and quickly accommodated my request for a chair in the condo (so I could sit out on the lanai). This is not glamour - it is great value, great location. JUst change the noisy air conditioners!

I planned a last minute romantic weekend getaway to Honolulu. The pictures in the ad looked very nice (pretty glossed up for what is actually there), however, when we arrived at the condo, we were sadly surprised. It looked like a low budget room at a Motel 6. Also, the condo is located at the front of the building and next to the metal entry gate that slams shut each time it is opened. We were up all night from hearing this gate slamming all night as people were returning from their late night activities. Also, the tv only had reception for one channel. A truly disappointing stay.

When we arrived at the place from Los Angeles for an overnight stay before flying back to Sydney. There was a sign that tells you that check in is in another building. Fortunately, i was with my son and I left him with the luggages while I went to the other building to check in. I hate to think of the other scenario where I was alone and had to carry my luggage to the other place.The condominium does not have lift but the hotel will have someone help carry the luggage to your room. Our room was clean. Beds soft and the kitchen was quite adequate. There was a fridge, microwave and plates, glasses, cups plus cutlery. WIfi was fast and efficient. Things that went wrong ... Our coffee maker did not work so I was not able to enjoy the Kona coffee offered in the room. TV would sometimes play up by shutting down by itself. During the night, our aircon gave up on us. As it broke in the middle of the night and the room did not have a phone, I did not want to go to the other building and tell them. I did complain the next day when I was checking out and was hoping for some kind of compensation like a discount or an apology. None was given. They did say that they will have someone check the aircon. Little comfort to one who was checking out that day. The budget hotel down the road and where we stayed before we flew to LA gave better service and had better facilities to this one. No recommendations from my end to family and friends for this establishment.

Just to note the difference there is the Stay Hotel where you check in which are hotel rooms, and then there is the Stay Condominiums which they manage and is a block away. On a business trip I stayed 3 nights at the Condominiums and it felt like my own little apartment. Whenever I come to Oahu, I am not on a vacation so I usually look for places that has a value price. Usually I am skeptical of the value price and ended up in some shady places, but this one was an exception to the rule and way above my expectations! It is a cozy updated studio apt that was clean with white décor which gave it a bright fresh feeling inside. It had all the comforts of home there in the kitchenette which includes fridge, dishes, pots pans, microwave, and coffee maker. My condo was on the ground floor. The location is so convenient to everything in Waikiki. I have finally found my go-to lodging! Whenever I am visiting, I will for sure check the availability of these condos first.

We needed a one night stay and I didn't want to spend too much money, but boy was this a dump. I was told that I was "upgraded" to a condo which is located at a different location. When the room was ready, they had an employee come out to show us to our room and I mentioned that I did need help with the luggage. He just kept on walking. We ended up getting our luggages ourselves. There were no elevators to our unit, so it didn't make it easy to carry up our luggages. The location of the hotel and condo were in between some run down apartment buildings. The room, although clean, was simple with a bed, faux leather sofa and a small kitchen. Everything was white (except the sofa) which made me feel like I was in mental health instittution. The bathroom was small with no place to hang up the towels and not a single full-body mirror. Owners or managers, please put a broom so people can sweep up the sand after a day at the beach. A few stools to sit on would be nice too, so we don't have to stand up to eat. They did have a soap and shampoo dispensor which was a nice though and the free internet was quick enough. The beach equipment available for guest is also a nice touch and the beach is only a block away. Overall, this is probably the worst hotel/condo that I have ever stayed at and I'm not that picky. If you are on a budget, then this is for you. If you want something a little nicer, look elsewhere. Tip: If the small parking lot ($25/night) is full, just ask the front desk. It's the employees that are parking there and they'll move their car. Bring you ear plugs too because you'll hear the garbage trucks at 6am in the morning.

staff was friendly,the lobby was clean and spacious, hot coffee available upon arrival. the room/studio was clean and spacious. everything was provided . we actually fell asleep rather quickly on a very large king size bed. check out was swift and easy.

We needed an inexpensive location near the beach to stay on our last night. This was walking distance to restaurants, shopping and the water, so my son and I felt safe - even at night. The view is horrible and the surrounding "motels" are a little sketchy, but we only were in the room for a few hours. The room was clean and customer service was excellent. Lilly at the front desk is amazing!

The location was fantastic, a block from Waikiki beach and all it has to offer. The staff were very pleasant and always a great help. Would definitely stay there again. Stayed one night at the hotel and four nights in the Condo, with a family of four, both good, the extra space and kitchen in the condo was worth it.

This was the perfect location for us, two adults travelling with a toddler, it was just two skinny blocks from Waikiki beach with loads of affordable places to eat and two cheap surfboard rental shops ($5per hour min 2 hours) right next door. The staff were wonderful and check-in at the Stay Hotel across the road was very easy, you also have access to their beach towels and equipment. The bathroom provided near the lobby gives a bad impression of what is to come as the room we had was great, newly renovated, clean and comfortable with a great kitchen area and cosy beds. The only down points were that the curtains let through too much light from the apartments behind and a curtain between the main bed and the sofa bed would be perfect for those travelling with small children. We would definitely stay again.

The rooms were clean, the staff was amazing, Lily at the front desk was great, friendly and extremely helpful, she went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed, will definitely stay here again. Everything was in walking distance.

The room was clean and well stocked with towels. Large kitchen and comfortable bed. Clean and very close to food markets and the Beach. Snack breakfast available and Coffee and tea. Staff very friendly and helpful. Located near tourist bus tours pick up location. Quiet and secure., Thanks to staff Tanya for my stay.

Our flight landed after 9 pm when we get to the hotel. I knew when I booked that the office was a block over. It had good reviews. We go to the office the girl tells me there is no parking, go down the street and pay 10 dollars for ten hours then you can move your car back here. Now understand we are tired from travel. I am not a happy camper. We drive back around the block to unload a family of 4 with 2 children a sleep up the stairs to the 3rd floor. After going back and forth 5 times. I come down to find I am about to get a parking ticket because there is no parking. The police let me move the car without a ticket. I go down the street to the parking garage. The guy tells me it will be $15 dollars and I have to move the car at 8:30.Now it is late so I set my alarm with the family sleeping I walk the block over ask where to move the car and a new girl at the front desk looks at me and asks are you on the waiting list. I told her I am going to park in space 3 load up my family by 11 am and leave and that is what I did.Now the GOOD. I will say the hotel is old but the room has a full kitchen, hot water, good internet. Great location. At the front desk they have great coffees and morning snacks. Beach toys to use and young people just hanging out having funIf you don’t need a car and can be happy in a 2 star room with a full kitchen and a balcony with no chairs. This can be a great place.

My wife and I stayed here during our recent one week long vacation in Honolulu. The hotel is actually a refurbished three level condominium building located roughly 100 meters from Waikiki Beach. The building is very close to most points of interest in Waikiki and at the same time it is set far enough back from the main strip as to avoid the worst of the congestion. The room was clean and comes with a full kitchen which was very useful. Four nights of every week they have a decent farmer's market right across the street from the building so if you get sick of restaurant food can you buy fresh ingredients and make a home cooked meal. The one issue we had which has been touched upon in other reviews is that there was no table or chairs in the actual unit when we arrived which would make it very if you are planning on cooking some of your own meals or even bringing take out food back to the room. I mentioned this to the front desk and by the time we came back from dinner on our first night they had placed a simple table and two chairs in our unit so problem solved. Evidently all of the units will be getting some dining stools and patio chairs in the near future. Generally speaking the unit provides good value at a great location and we would certainly stay the the Stay Condominiums Waikiki again.

I got burned by the high ratings (4.5 avg) for this place from other reviewers here. At least the sheets were clean, but apart from that, this place was a dump. The parking situation was awful. Three tiny spaces next to the premises, and don't think about moving your car--it's first come, first served, so you could lose your space. $25 for this.Check-in is at a different building--they gave an address, but I had no idea where it was. Eventually someone came to walk me over there, through a locked gate, then their laundry facilities and a rabbit warren of halls.My room location was so noisy--it was right by the gate where everyone staying there went in and out, slamming the door, shouting at their companions, clunking their suitcases up and down the stairs. I didn't feel safe or secure there, either.TV came with no instructions. No matter--there was no signal, either. It took an employee 30 minutes to get one station working, and that was all there was. The one lamp beside the bed was broken.No hair dryer.In spite of a kitchen, there was no place to eat--no table or chairs. $10 for amenities such as grab & go snacks, computer access in their lobby, coffee and use of beach equipment.Horrible value for the money they charge.

The room was small and dated, but it worked for four friends. The desk staff were some of the most friendly and helpful I have ever dealt with. Location was within two short blocks (5 minute walk tops) to Waikiki Beach and was better than we hoped for. Loved having a full kitchen so we could do our own food some of the time. We were able to walk to the start line and back from the finish line of the Honolulu marathon. The only reason this is not 5 star is because parking was an extra $20 to $25 per day unexpected (so budget for it) and the room was pretty dated.

Stayed here a week. This is a hotel with just 11 units. Check in was at the front desk of a larger hotel across the street. Hotel was 2 blocks off of the main part of Waikiki Beach. The room was clean and fresh, recently painted, and had a full kitchen. This was very private and one of the best stays and values I have had in Waikiki. I will be staying here again.

I stayed at the Stay Condo's while on my last business trip to Waikiki. The accommodations were simple, comfortable and affordable...which was exactly what I needed. The rooms were quiet and clean, and had a full size kitchen! Which was nice as I prefer not to eat out and was able to purchase healthier options to prepare myself.The condo's were located behind the Stay Hotel, but I liked that it was more private and separate from the hotel. I also appreciated the gated keycard entry to obtain access to the units. As a woman and staying alone, this made me feel very secure. Everything I could possibly need was within walking distance as well, which was very convenient. I was surrounded by markets, restaurants and shopping, so I didn't have to deal with the hassle of driving anywhere and fighting traffic. My daughter probably appreciated this as well, since it meant I had plenty of time to go buy her things in the evening. :)Overall, I had a great stay. I will certainly stay here the next time I am in town, as it feels more like a small apartment than a hotel room...Really had a nice home away from home feel to it. :)
user_name:
Ava L
New York City, New York

review_body: Nice place, clean and white could of used a little more color, but wasn't in the room a whole lot. Well worth what I paid for the room. Looked like it had been recently painted building was a little dated but I slept really well.

My wife and I were lucky enough to spend half of our honeymoon in Oahu of which 6 days were spent at the Stay Condos in Waikiki. The condo was spacious, clean, and had a very comfy bed. We were within 1 block to the beach, amazing shopping, and more restaurants than one could choose from. I would highly recommend the Stay to anyone visiting Oahu and will definitely be back!!

Great location, comfortable bed, good air conditioner, quiet location at night.,A FEW THINGS TO NOTE:They do charge $10 per day on top of the rate for motel amenities such as "beach gear", beach towels, breakfast, coffee etc.There is WIFI ONLY in the lobby of the "STAY waikiki hotel lobby" not the rest of the property or the condos which was quite annoying as it was one of the features which attracted us to the condo over the hotel.The Bed was made and the sheets were clean however The condo needed a real good clean, the floor had clearly only been swept at best, if we we staying longer than 2 nights i prob would have asked them to re-clean the room or move usBreakfast was sweet style "hawaiian" breads, apples, oranges, boxes cereal and bad coffee.There is a surf shop next door that hires boards and gear for $25.00 for two days which is worth checking out, there is an ABC store and a car hire place within 30meters of the condos.

Stayed at the Hotel twice and the condos once for the very first time. I love that you have a kitchenette in this place, eating in Waikiki can be costly. Wifi could use a little upgrade very spotty in places, but I love the island feel to the little studio space :)
